msbt.message: I was visiting my parents last week and we found a huge box full of old drawings I did.

One was this old drawing of my mom I did for art class, .We'd been fighting, so I made her look SUPER mean. But after we cooled off, I tried to change it.I thought I could make her look nice if I pushed real hard with my crayon, but it just made her lookweird.
I used to do all kinds of drawings of my dad's awesome cooking. Dad loved it, !But I'd usually start after we ate, so they were always from memory. Sometimes I wasn't even close!
I couldn't believe they kept 'em, . They're so awful!I mean, I guess it was kinda fun to see a few of 'embut most were just embarrassing!
I wonder how my nephews and nieces are doing. I hardly ever get to see them, .Whenever I visit, they'll run up to me like "! !" It's so adorable.Oh I know! I'll bring some -grown for them next time!

Turns out I'm related to some famous comedian.It's kinda surprising! Wonder if that means I should try doing stand-up.Then again, I really don't think he's all that funny Yeeeaaah, I should probably avoid open mic night.

I've got a cousin who's a teacher. Or at least I think she's my cousin. She's always so serious.Anyway, she reminds me of this teacher I had who was dead set on getting through to me, .All I can think is if my cousin's got any students like I used to beher work's definitely cut out for her!

Whenever I see a shooting gallery at the fair, I've gotta give it a go.I used to compete with a buddy whonow that I think about it, looked just like !I always crushed 'em, of course. I'm a crack shot, . But they kept tryin'!

When I was a kid, whenever we went to the fair, I'd always pester my parents for a mask.Usually they wouldn't budge, but if they did, I'd wear it for days!Hey, what's with that face? Some of those masks were really cool, !
I've got a serious weakness for those little powdered-sugar cakes you get at the fair, .Walking around, checking out all the neat stuff, munchin' on a funnel cake The best!

Ever had a part-time job? My parents REALLY didn't want me getting my first job.But there was a bunch of stuff I wanted to buy, so I begged and I begged. They FINALLY caved.I had that job for years! I think my parents were pretty impressed, !

I used to work in an arcade. One day this kid came in and took the top score on my favorite racer.I couldn't wait for him to leave. I wanted that top score back!I ended up playing for hours, but I did it! Top score! Go me!My boss wasn't too happy I'd spent all day playing though

All the DIY stuff I've been doing reminds me of a hardware store job I had, .We sold plants and tools and some other odds and ends. Anyway, we had a regular who was amazing!She built ALL KINDS of crazy stuff. Wild-looking fountains and windmills andjust awesome stuff!I wish you could meet her! She'd be like some kind of legend here.

I used to fight with my parents all the time. I've been thinking about that a lot lately, .Now I know the reason we fought so much was because they were trying to help me, but I just wouldn't listen.The stuff they said makes SO MUCH SENSE to me now I should really call them.

Chatting with you like this, sending messages, giftsIt all seems so totally normal, but this kind of friendship is tough to find. We can't take it for granted!So it's kinda embarrassing to say it, but Thanks for everything, .

I used to be likey'know, too edgy and tough and stuff to say "thank you."I had to make a serious effort to break that habit, but everyone really seemed to appreciate it once I did.One of these days, I need to tell my parents "thank you." It'll probably blow their minds, !
I was visiting my parents, and we found a photo of my great-grandma when she was still a little .I look so much like her, it was weird! I never knew her, butnow it kinda feels like I do, .

Sometimes I can't stand looking at photos of myself when I was small.Every one of 'em is the same. I'm always in the same old hoodie, and I've always got the same smirk. Ugh.Still, it's fun to remember what stuff was like when the photos were taken, so I guess that makes it worth it.

I was cleaning and found an old photo. There's a guy in it I haven't talked to in years.I wonder what he's been up to. Last I knew, he was the drummer for Bungalow.I really should call him and catch up. Maybe I can call his agent and get his number, .
